title: Astonishing moment a New Zealand rugby fan and a Japanese man clash after All Blacks defeat
text:
A New Zealand rugby fan has been filmed clashing with a Japanese man following the All Blacks' shock loss during the World Cup.

The two men were seen confronting each other while police attempted to pull them away.

The encounter came after the All Blacks lost 19-7 to England in the World Cup semi-final.

A New Zealand man (left) was seen screaming at a Japanese man (right) following the All Blacks' loss to England on Saturday

The Japanese man uploaded the video to Twitter saying he was out enjoying Halloween celebrations.

'This is when I wore a Halloween Minion (costume). I was suddenly struck by a foreigner and beaten,' he wrote.

In the video, a Minion costume can be seen on the floor next to the two men.

The New Zealander can be heard screaming: 'Let's go! Come on you f**king dog!'

The pair continue to square up to each other as a large group of police pull the men away from each other.

'You f**king weird c**t,' he yells as police drag him away from the Japanese man.

The video was posted on Saturday night local time, shortly after the All Blacks' shocking loss in the semi-final.

It is the first time the New Zealand team has failed to make the final since 2007, and they have won the past two World Cups.

The pair were seeing squaring up to fight as local police pulled them away from each other
description: Police were forced to separate an irate Kiwi and a Japanese man after they clashed following the All Blacks' shock defeat at the Rugby World Cup in Japan on Saturday.
authors: Lauren Ferri For Daily Mail Australia
